title: Object ID: 1967.06.139
text:
Culture (UDF1): Tigua


Object Name: Miniature




Other Name: Tigua Miniature Toy Bowl


Rec From: Robert Willis Sheriff




Artist/Creator (UDF2): NA


Locale (UDF10): Ysleta del Sur Pueblo




Source (UDF3): Robert Sherriff


Use (UDF5): Toy




Construction: (UDF6): Pinch


Height: 4.5




Length: 8


Width: 7.5



Description (UM) (UDF21): Child’s toy pot from Ysleta, Texas area. Two projections from the rim, four broken ones on the bottom, no design.
Additional Object/Collection Information (UDF22): There are two similar objects within this accession number due to the fact that .139 in box 36 doesn’t seem to have a place overall even though it’s listed as .130. When looking in the records, .130 is a completely different object than this, thus both of these two toy pots were listed as .139

title: Object ID: 1967.06.209
text:
Culture (UDF1): Mogollon


Object Name: Miniature




Other Name: Miniature Bowl


Rec From: Robert Willis Sheriff




Artist/Creator (UDF2): NA


Locale (UDF10): Quemado




Source (UDF3): Robert Sheriff


Use (UDF5): Domestic Use




Construction: (UDF6): Coiled


Height: 2.5




Length: 5.3


Width: 5



Description (UM) (UDF21): Gray ware ceramic miniature bowl with no decoration.
Additional Object/Collection Information (UDF22): Unknown Type: Possibly Alma Plain Notes call it a Tularosa Patterned Corrugated, but this is incorrect. Notes also call it a child’s pot, so it likely won’t fall into traditional types.
















Object Name: Miniature Bowl


Type: Unknown Plainware




Time Period: AD 200 – 1250


Donor: Robert Willis Sheriff



Miniature ceramic vessels like this one are not uncommon at prehistoric sites in the Southwest. Archaeologists have a variety of hypotheses to explain the presence of these vessels, but their purpose remains elusive. What do you think they were used for?

title: Object ID: 1969.17.02
text:
Culture (UDF1): Mogollon


Object Name: Jar




Other Name: NA


Rec From: Edna Hayes




Artist/Creator (UDF2): NA


Locale (UDF10): NA




Source (UDF3): Edna Hayes


Use (UDF5): Domestic Use




Construction: (UDF6): Coiled


Height: 22.8




Length: 0


Width: 27.6



Description (UM) (UDF21): Brown ware ceramic jar with two braided handles and neckbanding.
Additional Object/Collection Information (UDF22): Three Circle Neckcoiled Also called Three Circle Neck Corrugated
















Object Name: Jar


Type: Three Circle Neckcoiled




Time Period: AD 800 – 1000


Donor: Edna Hayes




Object ID: 1969.17.02



Braided handles like the one seen on this Mogollon jar are difficult to execute. The potter had to remove the air pockets in between the coils to prevent the handles from breaking during firing. This is difficult to do without accidentally pressing the individual coils together to form one larger coil.

Additional Object/Collection Information (UDF22): Looks like a transition between Puerco Black-on-White and Chaco-McElmo Black-on-White

title: Object ID: 1991.04.120
text:
Culture (UDF1): Hopi


Object Name: Vessel




Other Name: Hopi Seed Jar


Rec From: Dr. Florence S. Jenney




Artist/Creator (UDF2): Ellsworth Polacca Nampeyo


Locale (UDF10): Tuba City




Source (UDF3): Florence S. Jenney


Use (UDF5): Decorative




Construction: (UDF6): Coiled


Height: 0




Length: 0


Width: 0



Description (UM) (UDF21): Large earthenware seed jar with sgraffito design on two sides - one of a sunface katsina with feathered headdress, and the other of corn.
Additional Object/Collection Information (UDF22): Ellsworth is the son of Fannie Nampeyo, the grandson of the famous Hopi/Tewa potter Nampeyo.

title: Object ID: 1991.04.140
text:
Culture (UDF1): Santa Clara Pueblo


Object Name: Vessel




Other Name: Santa Clara Black on Black Bowl


Rec From: Dr. Florence S. Jenney




Artist/Creator (UDF2): Crescentia Tafoya


Locale (UDF10): Santa Clara Pueblo




Source (UDF3): Florence S. Jenney


Use (UDF5): Decorative




Construction: (UDF6): Coiled/Paddle and Anvil


Height: 4.4




Length: 0


Width: 6.4



Description (UM) (UDF21): Black on Black flat bowl. Has a geometric feather design on the top of the bowl, meanwhile on the base of the bowl is an inscription, the first part of which is unreadable, the othe part that states “Santa Clara Pueblo”. There is also a sticker on the back which states “#147 C. Tafoya Santa Clara $62.50.”
Additional Object/Collection Information (UDF22): NA

title: Object ID: 1991.04.163
text:
Culture (UDF1): Pojoaque Pueblo


Object Name: Miniature




Other Name: Pojuaque Blackware Miniature Serpent Jar

Locale (UDF10): Pojoaque Pueblo




Source (UDF3): Florence S. Jenney


Use (UDF5): Decorative




Construction: (UDF6): Coiled


Height: 0




Length: 0


Width: 0



Description (UM) (UDF21): Miniature polished black pottery jar with carved avanyu around the top. Signed “Lucy Yearflower, Potoaque Pueblo”.
Additional Object/Collection Information (UDF22): Lucy Yearflower is the daughter-in-law of Camillo Tafoya and the mother of Myra Littlesnow (1991.04.165), Kelli Little Kachina (1991.04.166), and Sean Tafoya (1991.04.164)

title: Object ID: 1991.04.168
text:
Culture (UDF1): Santa Clara Pueblo


Object Name: Miniature




Other Name: Santa Clara Joseph Lonewolf Seed Jar


Rec From: Dr. Florence S. Jenney




Artist/Creator (UDF2): Joseph Lonewolf


Locale (UDF10): Santa Clara Pueblo




Source (UDF3): Florence S. Jenney


Use (UDF5): Decorative




Construction: (UDF6): Coiled


Height: 0




Length: 0


Width: 0



Description (UM) (UDF21): Polished red with sgrafitto turkey, feather, and kiva step design. Signed “Joseph Lonewolf 175 1975.” Pindot size flaws or chips on side.
Additional Object/Collection Information (UDF22): Joseph Lonewolf is the son of Blue Corn (also a ceramicist). He introduced sgraffito to Santa Clara ceramics.

Description (UM) (UDF21): Small Black on black ceramic carinated jar with stepped and comb design around the shoulders. Signed “Blue Corn, San Ildefonso Pueblo”.
Additional Object/Collection Information (UDF22): Blue Corn (Crucita Gonzales Calbasa) (1921-1999) was a world famous potter since the early 1970’s

title: Object ID: 2012.13.01
text:
Culture (UDF1): Acoma Pueblo


Object Name: Vessel




Other Name: Acoma Olla


Rec From: Patricio, Robert




Artist/Creator (UDF2): Robert Patricio


Locale (UDF10): Acoma Pueblo




Source (UDF3): Robert Patricio


Use (UDF5): Decorative




Construction: (UDF6): Coiled


Height: 28




Length: 0


Width: 0



Description (UM) (UDF21): Olla by Acoma potter Robert Patricio; polychrome; combination of a traditional design with elements personal to Patricio. Patricio is of the Yellow Corn clan. Two corn stalks on opposite sides of olla, with upper border of rainbow and clouds (the 4 curved elements). Diamond-shaped checkerboards represent corn fields.
Additional Object/Collection Information (UDF22): Commissioned by the museum; At the invitation of the museum, Robert Patricio gave a pottery making and painting demonstration at the American Indian Week finale at the museum on April 14, 2012.

title: Object ID: 2012.16.01
text:

Object Name: Vessel




Other Name: Laguna Olla


Rec From: Seymour, Josephine




Artist/Creator (UDF2): Josephine Seymour


Locale (UDF10): Seama Village, Laguna Pueblo




Source (UDF3): Josephine Seymour


Use (UDF5): Decorative




Construction: (UDF6): Coiled


Height: 21.5




Length: 0


Width: 0



Description (UM) (UDF21): Earthenware Olla with white ground and black designs. Orange around the inside of the rim and black repeating trapezoids around the body.
Additional Object/Collection Information (UDF22): Commissioned by the museum with funding from Southwest and Border Cultures Institute.

title: Object ID: 2015.04.161
text:
Culture (UDF1): Isleta Pueblo


Object Name: Vase




Other Name: Wedding Vase


Rec From: Phillip L. Boucher




Artist/Creator (UDF2): Caroline Carpio


Locale (UDF10): NA




Source (UDF3): Phillip L. Boucher


Use (UDF5): NA




Construction: (UDF6): NA


Height: 22.86




Length: 0


Width: 22.86



Description (UM) (UDF21): This white vessel has two spouts with 5 stair-step pyramids cut into the spout openings. There is a twisted handle that connects the two spouts. One side of the vessel has an etched circle with a figure in the center resembling a zia or a cross and outside the circle there is a cut-out half circle design all the way around it that is textured on the interior. The opposing side has a piece of 3-D corn complete with stalk and silks that connected to the outside of the vessel
Additional Object/Collection Information (UDF22): NA

title: Object ID: 2015.04.216
text:
Culture (UDF1): Jemez Pueblo


Object Name: Vase




Other Name: Wedding Vase


Rec From: Phillip L. Boucher




Artist/Creator (UDF2): Helen Tafoya Henderson


Locale (UDF10): Zuni Pueblo




Source (UDF3): Phillip L. Boucher


Use (UDF5): Decorative




Construction: (UDF6): Coiled


Height: 15.24




Length: 0


Width: 12.065



Description (UM) (UDF21): This vessel has two spouts and a connected handle. One of the two spouts is completely tan with no other markings than the mica in the clay. This vessel was decorated using the sgraffito style and has a depiction of a humming bird in deep red with a turquoise eye on each side. The parts of the spouts above the black line has been polished as has the decoration and the bottom of the vessel.
Additional Object/Collection Information (UDF22): NA

title: Object ID: 2015.04.354
text:
Culture (UDF1): Taos Pueblo


Object Name: Vase




Other Name: Taos Wedding Vase


Rec From: Phillip L. Boucher




Artist/Creator (UDF2): George Gonzales


Locale (UDF10): Taos Pueblo




Source (UDF3): Phillip L. Boucher


Use (UDF5): Decorative




Construction: (UDF6): Coiled


Height: 30.48




Length: 0


Width: 0



Description (UM) (UDF21): Large micaceous earthenware vessel with two spouts and a handle connecting the spouts. The bottom of the vessel is inscribed and reads, “George Gonzales Chamita NM.”
Additional Object/Collection Information (UDF22): NA

title: Object ID: 2015.04.372
text:
Culture (UDF1): Zia Pueblo


Object Name: Vase




Other Name: Wedding Vase


Rec From: Phillip L. Boucher




Artist/Creator (UDF2): Ralph Aragon


Locale (UDF10): Zia Pueblo




Source (UDF3): Phillip L. Boucher


Use (UDF5): Decorative




Construction: (UDF6): Coiled


Height: 31.75




Length: 0


Width: 17.145



Description (UM) (UDF21): Painted polychromatic vessel with two spouts and a handle that connects the spouts. Both stylized and geometric motifs adorn the body and spouts of the vessel. The vessel is signed within an insignia on the base by the artist in ink. It reads, “R Aragon.”
Additional Object/Collection Information (UDF22): Ralph Aragon is a San Felipe painter and ceramacist who married into Zia. His incorporation of acrylic paint on the vessel is an innovation. (Sara Harper)

title: Object ID: 2015.04.379
text:
Culture (UDF1): Zuni Pueblo


Object Name: Vase




Other Name: Wedding Vase


Rec From: Phillip L. Boucher




Artist/Creator (UDF2): L. Kiyite


Locale (UDF10): Zuni Pueblo




Source (UDF3): Phillip L. Boucher


Use (UDF5): Decorative




Construction: (UDF6): Coiled


Height: 33.02




Length: 0


Width: 20.32



Description (UM) (UDF21): Polychromatic earthenware vessel with two spouts and a twisted handle connecting the spouts. Curvilinear and geometric motifs adorn the body and spouts of the vessel. The artist signed the bottom of the vessel. It reads, “L. Kiyite Zuni. NM 87327, Box #1226, 2/22/90.”
Additional Object/Collection Information (UDF22): NA

title: Object ID: 2015.04.399
text:
Culture (UDF1): Navajo/Diné


Object Name: Vase




Other Name: Dine Wedding Vase


Rec From: Phillip L. Boucher




Artist/Creator (UDF2): Elizabeth (Betty) Manygoats


Locale (UDF10): Navajo Reservation




Source (UDF3): Phillip L. Boucher


Use (UDF5): Decorative




Construction: (UDF6): Coiled/Sculpted


Height: 20.32




Length: 0


Width: 0



Description (UM) (UDF21): Earthenware vessel with two spouts and a handle connecting the spouts. The vessel’s body spouts and handle are covered in applied horned toad reliefs. The artist initialed the base of the vessel. It reads,“EM.”
Additional Object/Collection Information (UDF22): NA

title: Object ID: 2015.04.469
text:
Culture (UDF1): Isleta


Object Name: Vessel




Other Name: NA


Rec From: Phillip L. Boucher




Artist/Creator (UDF2): Stella Teller


Locale (UDF10): NA




Source (UDF3): Phillip L. Boucher


Use (UDF5): NA




Construction: (UDF6): NA


Height: 17.78




Length: 0


Width: 13.97



Description (UM) (UDF21): Polychromatic greenware vessel with two spouts and a handle connecting the spouts. The body of the vessel is white and a stairstep motif with geometric forms are painted on both faces. The rims have a thin painted black border, The handle has a curved line with dots. The artist signed the base, “Stella Teller Isleta N. Mex.” Owner’s Notes: White greenware Wedding Vase with parrot motif, red inside of spouts with black rims. Stella Teller, early work Acquired from The Adobe Gallery, Old Town, Albuquerque, NM No date or price of purchase was given.
Additional Object/Collection Information (UDF22): NA
















Object Name: Vessel


Type: Wedding Vessel




Time Period: Contemporary


Artist: Stella Teller




Donor: Phillip L. Boucher


Object ID: 2015.4.469



The body of the vessel is white and a stairstep motif with geometric forms are painted on both faces. The rims have a thin painted black border, The handle has a curved line with dots. The artist signed the base, “Stella Teller Isleta N. Mex.”
